Message: Some initial stuff, some of it works
Some more working stuff & repl love
Check in latest stuffGood enough to have lots of fun with the repl!
New png video streaming and other things
Implement client.sequence() featureMakes it easy to script hardcoded flight sequences.
Add PngSplitter#endJust needs to be there so Stream#pipe() does not freak out when thesource is done and it is trying to close the destination.
Some tracking stuffAlso better abstractions for handling the drone video feed (videoStream,imageStream, webCam);
Add PaVEParser parser and testsThis allows extracting h264 frames from the video feed. The nextchallenge is to embedd them into a browser streamable format (like mp4)
Add PngStream and expose it along with UdpControl
Better / working PngEncoder ! yeahAnd a nice integration test
Don't build in node 0.6 for nowtest-index is hanging for some reason
Remove old client codeThere is still work left to be done on the new code, but it should bevery usable now.
Will find a better place to track this
Delegate navdata error events if needed
Check signature in PaVEParserSeems like the drone is sending another unexpected 4 bytes of payloadright now ... fuck. Will just send the raw data stream to ffmpeg fornow.
Instructions to install from GithubMakes a lot of sense for this lib which is changing fast

Use npm test as primary test runner.Makefiles are not cross-platform, but if you want one, it can delegate to npm (which *is* cross-platform).See https://gist.github.com/2790533 for more tips on writing portable Node.js code.

Reverting to approach that allows test to pass.Unsure `ARDrone_SDK_2_0/ARDroneLib/Soft/Common/navdata_common.h:753` has `uint32_t link_quality` but using that: * Breaks a test * Produces a value from 0 - 500 * Causes strange behavior[^1][^1]: (Values were observed to start at 500 and gradually decline to 0 in about 10 seconds. Sometime later the value would incrementally increase back to 500 and, again, slide back down to 0.)

Maintain a single png and tcp stream in clientIntroducing two new API calls: getPngStream() and getVideoStream().Multiple calls to these methods return the same objects. The underlyingTcpVideoStream is the same and its lifecylce (connect/reconnect) ismanaged by the client.

Fixed errors in GPS data definitions.* Fixed incorrect order of unk0 & data_available fields.* Fixed misspellings.* Many fields are actually arrays (this was causing a lot of fields tohave nonsense values).Based on https://github.com/paparazzi/paparazzi/blob/55e3d9d79119f81ed0b11a59487280becf13cf40/sw/airborne/boards/ardrone/at_com.h
Merge pull request #71 from wiseman/fix_num_satsFixed errors in GPS data definitions.

Fixed test-parseNavdata tests (issue #72).* Removed the failing zimmu3000 option test--I think it's been obsoletedby GPS.* Fixed up test/fixtures/navdata.bin by replacing what looked like a bogus GPSoption with a real one, recorded from firmware 2.4.7 (and updated the checksumof the entire data packet).

Added unit tests for gps option.Not all values look legit to me--longitude, hdop and vdop look suspicious.I changed droneTimeToMilliseconds so it won't return negative times andfixed gps.last_frame_timestamp to be in milliseconds.
Merge pull request #73 from wiseman/fix_testsFixed parse-Navdata tests and added tests for gps.

Added handling of ACK for config commands.We now have two classes of commands: blocking and non-blocking.`CONFIG` is blocking, all others are non-blocking.  When a blockingcommand is sent, no other blocking commands will be sent until an ACKis received (and cleared) from the AR.Drone.
Added unit tests for CONFIG ACKs.
Merge pull request #77 from janpieper/fix-small-typo-in-readmeTypo in README
Changed signature of config.config can now be called as config(key, value, callback) or config(options).Added more info on config to README.
Fixed config signature to bring callback out of options.
Increased default timeout to 500 ms.Also removed vestigal retries references.
Increased delay in test to trigger timeout.
Merge pull request #76 from wiseman/config_acksAdded handling of ACK for config commands.

Changed NavdataReader.char to call buffy Reader.char.This fixes the bug where char wasn't advancing the buffer pointer,causing bad parses of the magneto and kalmanPressure navdata options(issue #90).

Updated GPS navdata definition for firmware version 2.4.8.I also took this opportunity to rename GPS data fields to beconsistent with existing nomenclature (that is, degreeMag instead ofdegree_mag).The new data definitions come fromhttps://github.com/AutonomyLab/ardrone_autonomy/pull/95 whichsupposedly came via backchannels from Parrot.I spliced a GPS navdata option collected from a drone running 2.4.8into test/fixtures/navdata.bin and updated the unit tests.

Fixes client up/down, left/right, front/back, clockwise/counterclockwise functions to accept 0 speed. Adds test. Resolves #106Previous implementation would not allow one to supply 0 for speed to stop moving along that axis. The only way to stop would be to issue a client.stop(). But that would also cancel any other movement going on at the time.For example, centering a joystick should stop pitch, but should not stop yaw being controlled by a dpad on the same controller.
Merge pull request #107 from michaelshmitty/masterAllows client to specify 0 speed
Merge pull request #110 from seanhussey/patch-1Fixed typos.

This should allow Travis builds to now pass. There was possible a BOM character at the begining of the package.json. The best fix is to tell Travis to use a more up to date version of npm and node. As 0.6 is ancient!
